business.headline: Tax reforms for rising Bharat: GST 2.0 big win for citizens, says Nirmala SitharamanThe Union Finance Minister said that GST reforms will be implemented much ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's instructions of launching them before Deepavali festival.

Potholes cost lives and money: How citizens can file for compensation in IndiaBeyond the headlines of tragedy lies a fundamental question that haunts every Indian who has suffered at the hands of negligent road maintenance: Can we actually hold the government accountable for these losses?

Scrapping 97 lakh unfit vehicles can fetch Rs 40,000 crore GST, says Nitin GadkariSpeaking at a recent event, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said large-scale scrappage of unfit and polluting vehicles could create jobs, boost demand and cut costs, while giving the Centre and states a major GST windfall.

Retire before 50? Here's how to turn that dream into realityWant to hang up your boots before 50? It's not just for billionaires. With deliberate choices, a strong savings habit, and careful planning, financial freedom can come decades earlier than most people imagine.

Only two days left: Why you should file ITR even if you earn under Rs 12 lakhWith two days left for FY 2024-25 ITR filing, experts stress the importance of filing for those earning under Rs 12 lakh. Neglecting this can lead to notices and penalties from the Income Tax Department.

FMCG firms say can't lower MRPs on Rs 5, 10, 20 packs despite GST cut: ReportInstead, companies said they will keep the same price but increase the quantity inside the pack. For example, a Rs 20 biscuit pack could now contain more grams of biscuits for the same price.

Sebi reclassifies REITs as equity: What it means for MFs and investorsAs part of amendments to the Sebi (Mutual Funds) Regulations, 1996, REITs will now be reclassified as "equity" instruments, while InvITs will continue to be treated as "hybrid" products. Read to know what it means for investors.

Sebi eases IPO norms for large firms: What it means for investorsUnder the revised norms, companies with post-issue market capital above Rs 1 lakh crore can gradually increase public shareholding to 25%. If public shareholding is below 15% at listing, it must rise to 15% within five years and to 25% within ten years.

Save up to Rs 2 lakh a year: Real estate tax hacks every investor should knowFor many Indians, property isn't just a place to live, it's a smart investment. But what often gets overlooked are the tax breaks that can make real estate even more rewarding.
Retail inflation rises marginally to 2.07% in August from 1.55% in JulyDespite edging up in August, inflation remains very low compared to recent years and well within the RBI's target range of 2–6%.

Sebi board meeting decisions in focus as markets rally for eighth straight sessionBut the bigger story now is what comes next from Sebi. The regulator's crucial board meeting is expected to decide on sweeping changes to futures and options trading.
Sensex closes 356 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; BEL gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 356 points to close at 81,904.70, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.50 points to end at 25,114.00.

entertainment.headline: Morgan Wallen dedicates song to late Charlie Kirk's family at Edmonton concertCountry singer Morgan Wallen paid tribute to Erika Kirk, widow of activist Charlie Kirk, during his Edmonton concert, dedicating a song just days after the tragedy.

Bigg Boss 19: Nagma Mirajkar, Natalia Janoszek out in first double evictionBigg Boss 19 sees its first elimination this season as Nagma Mirajkar and Natalia Janoszek leave the house in a double eviction. After their  new wild-card entries are expected in the Bigg Boss house.

Coldplay's Chris Martin asks fans to send love to Charlie Kirk's familyColdplay's Chris Martin paid tribute to Charlie Kirk at Wembley after the conservative activist was shot dead during an event in Utah.

Liam Hemsworth, Gabriella Brooks get engaged after 6 years of dating'The Witcher' star Liam Hemsworth is engaged to model Gabriella Brooks. The couple, together since 2019, confirmed it with an Instagram post.

Cocktail 2: Shahid Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna, Kriti Sanon start shootShahid Kapoor shared a selfie on Instagram to announce 'Cocktail 2' shooting with Kriti Sanon and Rashmika Mandanna, sparking excitement for the highly anticipated sequel.
Suniel Shetty reacts to India vs Pakistan clash:  Cannot blame cricketers for playingSuniel Shetty urged fairness towards cricketers amid boycott calls for India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash in Dubai.

O' Romeo: Vishal Bharadwaj's film with Shahid, Triptii set for Valentine's 2026Vishal Bhardwaj's upcoming film starring Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri is titled 'O'Romeo. The film has finally got a release date.

Salman Khan meets Ladakh governor Kavinder Gupta amid Battle of Galwan shootSalman Khan is currently shooting for his upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan'. Amid the schedule, the superstar met Ladakh governor Kavinder Gupta.

Mohanlal condemns homophobic remarks on Bigg Boss Malayalam 7Actor Mohanlal, on this weekend's 'Bigg Boss Malayalam 7', called out a contestant for his homophobic remarks and told her to leave the house if she cannot stand same-sex relationships on the show.

Bigg Boss 19: Farah Khan grills contestants, Akshay and Arshad join inIn the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19', Farah Khan grilled contestants with Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi joining for a drama-filled, emotional and entertaining Weekend Ka Vaar.

Kartik, Ananya to light up New Year's Eve with Tu Meri Main Tera... early releaseThe New Year celebrations will double this year with Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' releasing in theatres on the special occasion. The film was earlier scheduled to release on February 13, 2026.

Devon Ke Dev... actor Sonarika Bhadoria, husband Vikas Parashar announce pregnancyTelevision actor Sonarika Bhadoria is expecting her first child with husband Vikas Parashar. The couple announced the news in a special social media post.

Mirai box office Day 2: Teja Sajja film sees growth, inches close to Rs 30 croreActor Teja Sajja's film 'Mirai' roared at the box office. After witnessing a phenomenal opening, the film refused to slow down in theatres.

Salman Khan praises 15-year-old singer, urges not to exploit similar Indian talentSalman Khan is in awe of 15-year-old singer Jonas Conner. In a heartfelt social media post, the superstar praised the youngster and requested people to encourage and not exploit similar talents in India.

Rajinikanth, Stalin honour Ilaiyaraaja in grand ceremony, call for Bharat RatnaRajinikanth, Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin, and Kamal Haasan, among others, honoured Ilaiyaraaja at a grand event in Chennai. They urged the government to honour the maestro with Bharat Ratna.

Fawad Khan's Abir Gulaal to release in India? Government fact checks reportsAmid several reports confirming Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's 'Abir Gulaal' India release, the government fact-checked the reports and called it fake.

Ranveer Singh-Deepika Padukone enjoy romantic drive in new Hummer, pics go viralRanveer Singh and Deepika Padukone were recently seen taking a drive in their luxury electric car. A video from their outing has gone viral.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9 to premiere soon, Vijay Sethupathi's show gets launch date'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 will begin in October, with Vijay Sethupathi resuming hosting duties. The official channel has released a new poster announcing the premiere date.

Zayed Khan backs India as unbeatable ahead of Asia Cup 2025 clash with PakistanActor Zayed Khan voiced his support for India ahead of the Asia Cup 2025, calling the team unbeatable and highlighting the value of India-Pakistan clashes in fostering sportsmanship.

general news.headline: Attempts to break India-Russia ties destined to fail: Moscow amid Trump pressureThe Russian Foreign Ministry praised India for standing firm against constant pressure from the US and Nato to stop purchasing oil from Russia, and for continuing its commitments despite threats, warning that any attempt to disturb the ties is "destined to fail."

Won't surrender to far-right protesters: Keir Starmer on anti-immigration rallyPrime Minister Keir Starmer said the English flag "represents our diverse country," adding that he would not tolerate citizens being targeted for their "background or the colour of their skin."

Kulman Ghising likely to head Nepal's energy as Sushila Karki finalises her CabinetThe names of Kulman Ghising, Om Prakash Aryal, Rameshore Khanal, and Bala Nanda Sharma have been sent to Nepal's President as Nepal's interim Prime Minister Sushila Karki finalises her Cabinet.

Supreme Court to pronounce interim order on Waqf Act on MondayThe Supreme Court will pronounce its interim order on pleas seeking a stay on the Waqf Amendment Act 2025 on September 15, after reserving its decision on May 22.

From Bhagat Singh, Che Guevara to Nepal Gen Z, why youths rebelThat Gen Z protesters toppled the Oli government in Nepal shouldn't be surprising. From Bhagat Singh to Che Guevara, the face of rebellions has almost always been the young. But why do the young rebel, and what is it that drives them to the streets?

Finance ministry official killed, wife critical after BMW hits their bike in DelhiThe finance ministry official and his wife were returning home after visiting Bangla Sahib Gurdwara when their bike was hit by a BMW.

Why doesn't India buy US corn despite large population? Trump aide questionsHoward Lutnick described the current trade relationship as "one way," arguing that India benefits from access to the US market while restricting American goods.

UP woman, lover kill husband, take child along on bike while dumping bodyIn her statement, Neha described her frustration with the marriage and alleged harassment by her husband. She told police she no longer wanted to live with Nageshwar, and although divorce proceedings were ongoing, he refused to let her go. Fed up, Neha and Jitendra plotted the murder.

Shameful, say Pahalgam victims' families; nation calls for India-Pak match boycottJust hours ahead of the India and Pakistan Asia Cup clash, boycott the match was among the top trends on X. The boycott calls peaked even as families of Pahalgam terror attack victims joined actors, politicians and Army veterans to condemn the BCCI and the government for allowing the match.

Mohan Bhagwat says developing India proving doubters wrong, cites Winston ChurchillThe Rashtriya Swayam Sevak Sangh chief said that the world was conflict-free when India was the leader of the world for 3,000 years.

World Athletics Champs: Sarvesh Kushare becomes 1st Indian to reach high jump finalSarvesh Kushare made history by qualifying for the men's high jump final at the World Athletics Championships 2025. His achievement comes as Tokyo Olympics champion Gianmarco Tamberi missed out on Sunday in the Japanese capital.

India spared, China the new villain in Trump's latest tariff postAfter months of berating India as Moscow's enabler, Donald Trump has found a bigger villain in Beijing. In shifting his fury eastward, he spares New Delhi – but only to keep it from slipping deeper into Russia's embrace.

No Rohit Sharma in India A squad for one-day series vs Australia ARohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will miss India A's ODI series against Australia A in Kanpur. Rajat Patidar will be leading India A in the first one-day match, while Tilak Varma is set to lead in the following two.

Disha Patani's father was target of assailants who fired shots at their UP houseThe Goldy Brar gang claimed responsibility for the firing. Authorities confirmed several rounds of firing, including two rounds of aerial shots, in which no one was hurt.

Like father, unlike father: Zorawar Kalra on family, food, and fatherhood his wayWe convince restaurateur Zorawar Kalra to take a rare pause from work to talk about marriage, growing up under his legendary father Jiggs Kalra, parenting, food at home, and fitness... basically, Anything But work.
From the India Today archives (2024) | Gen Z and the new terms of engagementThey overturned power in Bangladesh last year and have just pulled off a reset in Nepal. How Generation Z thinks and works

Cocktail 2: Shahid Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna, Kriti Sanon start shootShahid Kapoor shared a selfie on Instagram to announce 'Cocktail 2' shooting with Kriti Sanon and Rashmika Mandanna, sparking excitement for the highly anticipated sequel.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

DMK delivered beyond manifesto: Stalin on EPS's broken poll promises chargeChief Minister MK Stalin pointed out that of the 505 poll promises made by the DMK, 364 had been implemented, 40 were under government review, and another 37 schemes were awaiting Union government clearance.

Zelenskyy praises Ukrainian strikes on Russian oil sites and border areasUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky praised forces for inflicting major losses on Russia through frontline, border and long-range strikes, highlighting successful drone attacks on oil terminals and stressing energy infrastructure as key to weakening Moscow's war effort.

Bigg Boss 19: Nagma Mirajkar, Natalia Janoszek out in first double evictionBigg Boss 19 sees its first elimination this season as Nagma Mirajkar and Natalia Janoszek leave the house in a double eviction. After their  new wild-card entries are expected in the Bigg Boss house.

My brain worth Rs 200 crore, I earn honestly: Nitin Gadkari amid E20 petrol rowUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari, seemingly brushing aside allegations of personal gain from the government's ethanol initiative, asserted that he earns honestly and claimed his intellect is worth Rs 200 crore a month.
ED summons actor Urvashi Rautela, ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty in betting app caseBollywood actress Urvashi Rautela and Mimi Chakraborty were summoned by the ED in connection with the 1xBet betting case.

Why Navi Mumbai Airport could be model for India's 200-plus airport revolutionSet for a September 30 inauguration by PM Narendra Modi, the Adani Group-built airport holds the key to maintaining Mumbai's heft as a key financial capital of the world

sports.headline: India sent a message to entire world with dominant win over Pakistan: GavaskarLegendary batter Sunil Gavaskar has said that India are making a strong statement for the rest of the cricketing world with their back-to-back resounding victories in the Asia Cup 2025. India hammered Pakistan by seven wickets in their second fixture of the continental tournament and continued their dominance over arch-rivals.

India showed how to play T20, clueless Pakistan no match for us: Harbhajan SinghFormer India spinner Harbhajan Singh feels Pakistan is no match for India after their crushing seven-wicket defeat against the Men in Blue in the Asia Cup 2025. India chased down the target of 129 in 15.5 overs against the arch-rivals and dedicated their resounding victory to the victims of the Pahalgam terrorist attack and the Indian armed forces,

Few things bigger than sportsman spirit: Suryakumar defends handshake snubAsia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav defended his decision not to shake hands with Pakistan players during their group-stage match in Dubai. He was responding to a journalist who asked whether refusing the gesture was against sportsman's spirit.

Kuldeep reveals secret behind dominance over Pakistan after match-winning spellKuldeep Yadav delivered a match-winning spell against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2025. He registered figures of 3/18 in four overs to restrict Pakistan to 127/9 in 20 overs.

Ruben Amorim backs philosophy despite Manchester United's 3-0 thrashing to CityRuben Amorim stood firm on his football philosophy despite Manchester United's disastrous start, including a 3-0 derby defeat to City. As results worsen, pressure mounts on INEOS to decide whether to back or sack him.

After handshake snub, Pakistan captain skips post-match presentation ceremonyAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan captain Salman Agha skipped the post-match presentation following his team's loss to India in Dubai on Sunday, after Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav avoided the customary pre-match handshake.

Suryakumar dedicates India's win over Pakistan to Pahalgam victims, armed forcesAsia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the cricket team stood with the victims of the terror attack in Pahalgam and dedicated their dominant win over Pakistan to the armed forces.

Same old story: India crush listless Pakistan in clash of unequals at Asia CupAsoa Cup: India hammered Pakistan by seven wickets in an one-sided affair in Dubai on Sunday. Pakistan lacked tactical nous as Indian spinners ran riot, exposing the gulf in class between the two teams.

They can't read Kuldeep: Wasim Akram blasts Pakistan batters over flop show Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram criticised his team's batting failure against India in Asia Cup 2025. Pakistan scored 127/9 in their 20 overs as Kuldeep Yadav ran through their batting with a three-wicket haul.

India make poor start to World Cup preps as Australia dominate ODI series openerAustralia Women dominated India in the first ODI, winning by eight wickets and extending India's losing streak against them in ODIs. Phoebe Litchfield starred with 88 runs, while India's strong start was let down by their middle order and ineffective bowling, raising concerns ahead of the Women's World Cup.

Saim Ayub does a Babar Azam with golden duck against IndiaSaim Ayub became the second Pakistani opener after Babar Azam to be dismissed for a golden duck against India in T20Is, falling to Hardik Pandya in the 2025 Asia Cup clash. Struggling with form, Ayub also registered a golden duck against Oman, highlighting a rough patch in his T20I career.

Phoebe Litchfield starred with 88 runs, while India's strong start was let down by their middle order and ineffective bowling, raising concerns ahead of the Women's World Cup.

Struggling with form, Ayub also registered a golden duck against Oman, highlighting a rough patch in his T20I career.

Australia suffer injury scare before World Cup after Ellyse Perry retires hurtEllyse Perry retired hurt during the first ODI against India, causing concern for Australia's World Cup plans. Her injury could affect Australia's middle order strength in the upcoming tournament.

Arshdeep Singh misses out again as India name unchanged XI vs PakistanIndia have named an unchanged playing XI for their crucial Asia Cup 2025 clash against Pakistan. The omission of top wicket-taker Arshdeep Singh has sparked debate ahead of the match at Dubai.

Suryakumar Yadav snubs handshake with Pakistan captain at tossIndia captain Suryakumar Yadav avoided the customary handshake with Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha during the Asia Cup toss in Dubai on Sunday, September 14.

Pakistan leave out Haris Rauf for high-voltage India clashPakistan has excluded fast bowler Haris Rauf from the Asia Cup match against India. The team will rely on Shaheen Afridi and a strong spin attack to counter India at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Oblique Seville emulates Usain Bolt, beats Noah Lyles for 100m goldWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Oblique Seville clinched the men's 100m gold in Tokyo. The 24-year-old beat Kishane Thompson and Noah Lyles in a breathtaking race. Meanwhile, Melissa Jefferson obliterated the women's 100m field, winning gold with a Championship record of 10.61s.

No Rohit Sharma in India A squad for one-day series vs Australia ARohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will miss India A's ODI series against Australia A in Kanpur. Rajat Patidar will be leading India A in the first one-day match, while Tilak Varma is set to lead in the following two.

Nawaz must prove Pakistan head coach hasn't lost his mind: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly has made a sharp remark on Pakistan spinner Mohammad Nawaz ahead of the Asia Cup clash between the two teams. Ganguly also commented on the talent gap between current Pakistan players and their legends.

Pakistan leave out Haris Rauf for high-voltage India clashPakistan has excluded fast bowler Haris Rauf from the Asia Cup match against India. The team will rely on Shaheen Afridi and a strong spin attack to counter India at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Oblique Seville emulates Usain Bolt, beats Noah Lyles for 100m goldWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Oblique Seville clinched the men's 100m gold in Tokyo. The 24-year-old beat Kishane Thompson and Noah Lyles in a breathtaking race. Meanwhile, Melissa Jefferson obliterated the women's 100m field, winning gold with a Championship record of 10.61s.

Nawaz must prove Pakistan head coach hasn't lost his mind: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly has made a sharp remark on Pakistan spinner Mohammad Nawaz ahead of the Asia Cup clash between the two teams. Ganguly also commented on the talent gap between current Pakistan players and their legends.

World Athletics Champs: Sarvesh Kushare becomes 1st Indian to reach high jump finalSarvesh Kushare made history by qualifying for the men's high jump final at the World Athletics Championships 2025. His achievement comes as Tokyo Olympics champion Gianmarco Tamberi missed out on Sunday in the Japanese capital.

CSK star shines, but South Zone face crushing loss vs Central ZoneDuleep Trophy: Andre Siddarth stood firm with an unbeaten 84, helping South Zone reach 426 and avoid an innings defeat, but Central Zone still need just 64 runs with all wickets in hand to win the title.

British boxing legend Ricky Hatton dies aged 46 ahead of December comebackBritish boxing legend Ricky Hatton has died aged 46. The former world champion, who had been planning a comeback later this year, leaves behind a legacy of thrilling fights and fearless performances cherished worldwide.

World Boxing Championships: Jaismine, Minakshi topple Olympic medallists to win titleJaismine Lamboria and Minakshi Hooda secured titles at the World Boxing Championships by taking down opponents who were both Olympic medallists.

How to watch World Athletics Championships live in India on TV, onlineIndia has sent a 19-member team to the 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, led by javelin champion Neeraj Chopra. Here's how you can watch the top athletes from the country.

Sunil Chhetri named in Khalid Jamil's India probables for AFC Asian Cup qualifiersSunil Chhetri returns to India's probables for the AFC Asian Cup qualifiers, after being left out of the CAFA Cup squad. His recall adds experience and leadership as India prepares for back-to-back matches against Singapore.

Double blow to India at Hong Kong Open as Lakshya, Satwik-Chirag lose finalsLi Shi Feng defeated Lakshya Sen in straight games to claim the Hong Kong Open Super 500 title. Earlier in the day, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty lost the men's doubles final.

Hong Kong Open: Satwik-Chirag falter under pressure, lose final to Chinese pairIndia's Satwiksairah Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty lost in the final of the Hong Kong Open on Sunday. Despite showing promise, the duo faded away after winning the first game.

IND vs PAK Highlights: India thrash Pakistan by 7 wicketsIndia vs Pakistan, Asia Cup Highlights: India cruised to a commanding 7-wicket win over Pakistan, powered by standout performances from Suryakumar Yadav and Abhishek Sharma. The result extends India's dominance in T20Is, with 11 victories in 14 clashes against their arch-rivals.
India vs Pakistan: Fans pray for team's success ahead of Asia Cup matchFans across the country offer prayers ahead of India's group stage match in the Asia Cup against Pakistan.

Aman Sehrawat fails weight test, disqualified from Wrestling Worlds: ReportsIndian wrestler Aman was reportedly disqualified for being overweight at the Wrestling World Championships in Zagreb. This comes as a major setback to the Indian wrestling contingent.

Tokyo Day 2 highlights: Oblique Seville beats Noah Lyles in men's 100m finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025 Day 2 Highlights: Oblique Seville becomes the first Jamaican since Usain Bolt in 2015 to win the men's 100m world meet gold. He beats Kishane Thompson and Noah Lyles in a cracking final. Meanwhile, Melissa Jefferson obliterated the women's 100m field, clocking 9.61s for gold with a Championship record. Earleir in the day, India's Sarvesh Kushare scripted history by qualifying for the men's high jump final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
